issue.title: Build SplitSync (Expense Sharing App)
issue.body:
# Product Requirements Document: SplitSync
## Expense Sharing Application

**Version:** 3.0  
**Status:** Production-Ready MVP  
**Last Updated:** January 2026

---

## Executive Summary

SplitSync is a real-time expense sharing application that allows groups to track shared expenses, calculate optimal debt settlements, and manage group finances transparently. The system prioritizes financial accuracy, security, and operational reliability for production deployment.

---

## Tech Stack
- Node.js 20 LTS (aligns with Next.js 16 requirements)
- Next.js 16.1.4 (App Router)  
- TypeScript 5.9.3 (strict mode)
- SQLite (via better-sqlite3 12.6.2)
- Drizzle ORM 0.45.1
- Zod 4.3.5
- NextAuth.js 4.24.13 (track v5 release for future upgrade)
- Socket.io 4.8.3
- Tailwind CSS 4.1.18 + @shadcn/ui 0.0.4
- React Hook Form 7.71.1
- Vitest 4.0.17 (unit & integration tests)
- Playwright 1.50.0 (E2E tests with full browser automation)
- GitHub Actions CI/CD (lint, typecheck, test, build pipelines)

---

## 1. Technical Architecture

### 1.1 Technology Stack

**Core Framework:**
- Node.js 20 LTS runtime environment
- Next.js 16.1.4 with App Router architecture
- TypeScript 5.9.3 in strict mode for type safety

**Data Layer:**
- SQLite database via better-sqlite3 12.6.2
- Drizzle ORM 0.45.1 for type-safe database operations
- Zod 4.3.5 for runtime schema validation

**Authentication & Real-time:**
- NextAuth.js 4.24.13 for authentication flows (monitor v5 for future migration)
- Socket.io 4.8.3 for real-time bidirectional communication

**User Interface:**
- Tailwind CSS 4.1.18 for utility-first styling
- shadcn/ui 0.0.4 component library
- React Hook Form 7.71.1 for form state management

**Testing & CI/CD:**
- Vitest 4.0.17 (unit & integration tests)
- Playwright 1.50.0 (E2E tests with full browser automation)
- Vitest 4.0.17 for unit and integration testing
- GitHub Actions for continuous integration and deployment
- Docker for containerized deployment

### 1.2 Core Functional Requirements

**Group Management:**
- Create and manage expense sharing groups
- Generate secure, time-limited invite links
- Role-based member management (admin, member)
- Group archival and deletion with data retention policies

**Expense Tracking:**
- Record expenses with metadata (description, amount, payer, date)
- Equal split calculation across group members
- Expense categorization and tagging
- Expense editing with audit trail
- Attachment support for receipts

**Settlement Engine:**
- Debt graph calculation from expense history
- Optimal settlement path computation (minimize transactions)
- Settlement marking and tracking
- Settlement history and verification

**Real-time Synchronization:**
- Live expense updates across all group members
- Real-time balance recalculation
- Connection state management and reconnection logic
- Optimistic UI updates with conflict resolution

**Authentication & Authorization:**
- Google OAuth provider integration
- Email/password credential authentication
- Session management with secure token handling
- Protected routes and API endpoints
- Role-based access control per group

---

## 2. Non-Functional Requirements

### 2.1 Data Integrity & Financial Accuracy

**Money Handling:**
- All monetary values stored as integers representing smallest currency unit (cents)
- No floating-point arithmetic in financial calculations
- Rounding rules documented and consistently applied
- Transaction atomicity for all financial operations

**Validation:**
- Zod schemas defined for all input data structures
- Server-side validation on all API endpoints
- Client-side validation for immediate user feedback
- Type safety enforced throughout the application stack

### 2.2 Performance & Scalability

**Response Time Targets:**
- API response time: p95 under 200ms for CRUD operations
- Settlement calculation: under 500ms for groups up to 50 members
- Real-time event propagation: under 100ms latency

**Concurrency:**
- Support multiple concurrent users per group
- Optimistic locking for expense modifications
- Connection pooling for database access

### 2.3 Security Requirements

**Data Protection:**
- TLS 1.3 for all data in transit
- Database file encryption at rest
- Secure key management via environment variables or secret stores
- No sensitive data in client-side storage

**Authentication Security:**
- OAuth 2.0 compliance for third-party authentication
- Secure password hashing (bcrypt or argon2)
- Session timeout and automatic invalidation
- CSRF protection on state-changing operations
- Rate limiting on authentication endpoints

**Authorization:**
- Principle of least privilege for all operations
- Invite link expiration and one-time use options
- Audit logging for sensitive operations (expense creation/deletion, settlements)

### 2.4 Operational Requirements

**Observability:**
- Structured JSON logging with correlation IDs
- Error tracking with stack traces and context
- Request metrics (duration, status, endpoint)
- Business metrics (expenses created, settlements calculated, active users)
- Dashboard for key performance indicators

**Monitoring & Alerting:**
- Health check endpoints for uptime monitoring
- Database connection pool monitoring
- Memory and CPU utilization tracking
- Alert rules for error rate thresholds, response time degradation, authentication failures
- On-call rotation with automated notifications

**Backup & Recovery:**
- Automated daily database backups to external storage
- Point-in-time recovery capability
- Documented backup restoration procedure
- Backup integrity verification
- Retention policy: 30 days for daily backups, 12 months for monthly snapshots

**Release Management:**
- GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline with automated testing
- Branch protection requiring passing checks
- Semantic versioning for releases
- Blue-green or canary deployment strategy
- Automated rollback capability

### 2.5 Compliance & Privacy

**Data Privacy:**
- GDPR compliance for EU users (right to access, right to deletion, data portability)
- CCPA compliance for California users
- Privacy policy and terms of service
- User consent mechanisms for data processing
- Data retention limits and automated cleanup

**Data Minimization:**
- Collect only necessary user information
- Anonymous usage analytics where possible
- User data deletion scripts
- Clear data retention policies documented

---

## 3. Project Setup & Development Roadmap

### 3.1 Phase 0: Foundation Setup (Blocking Tasks)

**Timeline:** Days 1-2  
**Dependencies:** None  
**Deliverables:** Initialized repository with baseline infrastructure

**Critical Path Tasks:**

1. **Repository Initialization**
   - Create GitHub repository with appropriate visibility settings
   - Configure branch protection rules (require PR reviews, passing CI)
   - Set up GitHub Secrets for sensitive configuration
   - Initialize README with project overview and setup instructions

2. **Base Project Structure**
   - Initialize Next.js 16 project with TypeScript and App Router
   - Configure TypeScript strict mode and compiler options
   - Set up directory structure (app, lib, components, hooks, types, tests)
   - Configure absolute imports with path aliases

3. **CI/CD Pipeline Setup**
   - Create `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with parallel jobs:
     - Linting (ESLint with strict rules)
     - Type checking (tsc with noEmit)
     - Unit tests (Vitest)
     - Integration tests
     - Build verification
   - Configure caching for node_modules and build artifacts
   - Set up automated dependency updates (Dependabot or Renovate)

4. **Development Environment**
   - Create `.env.example` with all required environment variables
   - Document local development setup in README
   - Configure VS Code workspace settings and recommended extensions
   - Set up pre-commit hooks for linting and formatting

5. **Docker Configuration**
   - Create Dockerfile with multi-stage build
   - Create docker-compose.yml for local development
   - Document container build and run process
   - Health check configuration

**Success Criteria:**
- Repository is cloneable and runnable with documented commands
- CI pipeline runs successfully on push and PR
- All team members can run the project locally
- Docker builds successfully

---

## 4. Success Metrics

### 4.1 Development Velocity
- 95% of CI pipeline runs pass on first attempt
- Average PR cycle time under 24 hours
- Zero critical bugs in production first month
- Feature completion within estimated timelines

### 4.2 Application Performance
- API p95 response time under 200ms
- Settlement calculation under 500ms for typical groups
- Real-time event latency under 100ms
- Zero data loss or corruption incidents

### 4.3 User Experience
- Mobile responsive on all major devices
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance score of 100%
- Zero accessibility blockers
- Intuitive UI validated through user testing

### 4.4 Operational Excellence
- 99.9% uptime in production
- Mean time to recovery (MTTR) under 30 minutes
- Zero security incidents
- Successful backup restoration drills

---

*Build this complete expense sharing application with all the features specified above.*

ems.task: Initialize project foundation: create repository config, Next.js setup, TypeScript config, ESLint/Prettier, CI/CD pipeline, Docker configuration, environment templates, and README documentation

workers.task: Initialize complete project foundation: create repository root files (.gitignore, README.md, LICENSE), initialize Next.js 16 project with TypeScript strict mode, configure package.json with all dependencies (Next.js 16.1.4, React 19.1.0, TypeScript 5.9.3, Drizzle ORM 0.45.1, better-sqlite3 12.6.2, Zod 4.3.5, NextAuth.js 4.24.13, Socket.io 4.8.3, Tailwind CSS 4.1.18, shadcn/ui 0.0.4, React Hook Form 7.71.1, Vitest 4.0.17, Playwright 1.50.0, ESLint, Prettier), create TypeScript config (tsconfig.json with strict mode and path aliases), create ESLint config (.eslintrc.js), create Prettier config (.prettierrc), create Docker configuration (Dockerfile with multi-stage build, docker-compose.yml, .dockerignore), create environment templates (.env.example, .env.local.example), create GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline (.github/workflows/ci.yml with lint, typecheck, test, build jobs, and caching), create Vitest config (vitest.config.ts), create Playwright config (playwright.config.ts), create Next.js config (next.config.js), create Tailwind config (tailwind.config.ts, postcss.config.mjs), create VS Code workspace settings (.vscode/settings.json, .vscode/extensions.json, .vscode/tasks.json), create directory structure (app/, lib/, components/, hooks/, types/, tests/, prisma/drizzle/, public/), create base layout (app/layout.tsx with metadata and root structure), create global styles (app/globals.css with Tailwind directives), create base page (app/page.tsx with placeholder), create Drizzle configuration (drizzle.config.ts), create README.md with comprehensive setup and deployment instructions

ems.task: Implement data layer with SQLite database schema, Drizzle ORM configuration, Zod validation schemas, and database migration scripts for groups, users, expenses, and settlements

workers.task: Create SQLite database schema with Drizzle ORM for all tables (groups, users, expenses, settlements) with proper indexes, foreign keys, and constraints
Configure Drizzle ORM with SQLite connection, create database client, and write migration scripts for schema initialization and versioning
Create comprehensive Zod validation schemas for all domain entities (groups, users, expenses, settlements) with API request/response validation patterns

ems.task: Build authentication system with NextAuth.js, including Google OAuth, email/password credentials, session management, protected routes middleware, and role-based access control
Create API routes for group management, expense CRUD operations, settlement calculations, and member management with validation and error handling

workers.task: Create API routes for group management including group CRUD operations, invite link generation, and member role management with validation and error handling
Create API routes for expense CRUD operations including expense creation, retrieval, update, deletion, and category management with validation
Create API routes for settlement calculations, settlement management, and member balance tracking with debt graph algorithms

ems.task: Implement settlement calculation engine with debt graph algorithms, optimal path computation, transaction minimization, and settlement tracking

workers.task: Implement core debt graph data structures and algorithms. Create the graph representation, balance calculation logic, and cycle detection utilities in src/lib/settlement/graph/.
Implement optimal settlement path computation with transaction minimization algorithms. Create path optimizer, settlement generator, and net flow calculator in src/lib/settlement/optimizer/.

Implement settlement tracking, persistence layer, and main settlement engine API. Create settlement storage, verification, history tracking, and the unified engine orchestrator in src/lib/settlement/.

ems.task: Build core UI components using shadcn/ui, including forms, cards, tables, dialogs, buttons, and layout components for the application interface

workers.task: Create form components using shadcn/ui - build reusable form input components (Input, Textarea, Select, Checkbox, RadioGroup) with proper TypeScript types and validation integration
Create layout and container components using shadcn/ui - build Card, Button, Dialog, Alert, Toast, and layout components for structuring the application interface
Create data display components using shadcn/ui - build Table, ScrollArea, Tooltip, Popover, DropdownMenu, and loading state components for displaying expense data

ems.task: Create feature-specific components for expense display, group management dashboards, member lists, and expense tracking interfaces

workers.task: Create expense display components including ExpenseCard, ExpenseList, ExpenseDetails, and ExpenseForm components with TypeScript interfaces and validation schemas
workers.error: Claude Code process exited with code 1

workers.task: Create group management dashboard components including GroupDashboard, GroupStats, GroupActions, InviteLinkGenerator, and GroupSettings components
Create member management components including MemberList, MemberCard, MemberRoleBadge, AddMemberModal, and ExpenseTrackingInterface with balance display components
workers.error: Claude Code process exited with code 1

ems.task: Implement page routes and views for dashboard, group details, expense creation, settlement overview, and user settings with data fetching and state management

workers.task: Create dashboard page route with expense overview, recent activity, and balance summary components
Create group details page with expense list, member management, and real-time updates
Create expense creation page, settlement overview, and user settings pages

ems.task: Build real-time synchronization with Socket.io server and client, connection management, live expense updates, balance recalculation, and optimistic UI updates with conflict resolution

workers.task: Create Socket.io server infrastructure with connection management, room management, and event handlers
workers.error: Claude Code process exited with code 1

workers.task: Build client-side Socket.io integration with connection management, reconnection logic, and hooks
Implement optimistic UI updates with conflict resolution and event propagation system

ems.task: Implement comprehensive testing with Vitest unit tests, integration tests for API routes, Playwright E2E tests for critical user flows, and test utilities

workers.task: Create comprehensive Vitest unit test suite for all utility functions, business logic, and core services. This includes expense calculation logic, settlement algorithms, debt graph computations, currency utilities, validation schemas, and helper functions.

Create comprehensive Vitest integration test suite for all API routes and database operations. This includes testing CRUD operations for expenses, groups, users, settlements, authentication endpoints, and database integration with Drizzle ORM.

Create comprehensive Playwright E2E test suite for all critical user flows. This includes authentication flows, expense creation and management, group creation and member management, settlement calculation and recording, real-time updates, and test utilities/fixtures.
workers.error: Claude Code process exited with code 1

ems.task: Add production readiness features: structured logging, error tracking, health checks, metrics collection, backup scripts, security hardening, and deployment documentation

workers.task: Implement structured logging system with correlation IDs, log levels (debug, info, warn, error), and context metadata. Create logger utility, middleware for request logging, Winston/Pino configuration, and integration tests.

Implement error tracking system with Sentry integration, error boundaries, error reporting utilities, and error context collection. Create error classes, tracking service, React error boundaries, API error handlers, and unit tests.

Implement health check endpoints, metrics collection, and monitoring infrastructure. Create health check routes for database, external services, and system resources. Implement Prometheus-style metrics, performance monitoring, and alert configuration.

analysisSummary: Build SplitSync, a production-ready expense sharing application with real-time sync, group management, expense tracking, settlement calculations, and authentication. Using Next.js 16, TypeScript, SQLite/Drizzle, NextAuth, Socket.io, and shadcn/ui with comprehensive testing and CI/CD.
